meanings.definition: A print made by lithography, especially in color.
meanings.sent1: I saw beautiful chromolithographs of flowers at the art gallery.
meanings.sent2: The museum had a collection of chromolithographs from the 19th century.
meanings.sent3: The chromolithographs of animals looked so lifelike, I almost thought they were real!
meanings.sent4: Her room was filled with chromolithographs, turning it into a vibrant garden.
meanings.sent5: The chromolithographs of landscapes were so vivid, it felt like stepping into a painting.

meanings.sent1: The artist carefully chromolithographs the design onto the stone.
meanings.sent2: She learned how to chromolithograph illustrations for the book.
meanings.sent3: When the machine broke, he had to chromolithograph the posters by hand!
meanings.sent4: His creativity knows no bounds; he can chromolithograph dreams into reality.
meanings.sent5: Watching him chromolithograph was like witnessing magic on paper.
